Authors: Shing-Yi Ye, Fang Wu, Long Fei Fan
Title:
Two new species from China in the Exidia glandulosa
(Auriculariales, Basidiomycota) complex
Abstract:
Exidia glandulosa is a cosmopolitan species and it was
previously considered as a single species reported in China. 17
specimens of so-called E. glandulosa were analyzed based on
morphological and molecular data. The phylogenetic analyses were carried
out by the ITS+28S dataset and the ITS+28S+tef1-a+rpb2 dataset, and 20
ITS, 20 28S, 22 tef1-a and 20 rpb2 sequences were newly generated.
According to morphological and molecular anslyses, the so-called E.
glandulosa are actually three species in China, including the real E.
glandulosa and two new species, E. effusa and E. subglandulosa. Detailed
descriptions with macro- and micromorphological photos are provided for
these two new species, and their morphological distinguishes and
phylogenetic relationships with similar species are discussed.
